titleStmt.title: The phanaticks plot discovered being a true relation of their strange proceedings in Glocester-shire and other counties; and what hath since hapned upon the appearing of the two great bodies of frogs and toads, (as they pretended) in sundry shapes and dreadful colours; to the great wonder of all loyal subjects, that shall seriously peruse these following lines. To the tune of, Packingtons pound.

publicationStmt.publisher: Entred according to order. And printed for Samuel Burdet,

notesStmt.note: Verse - "Kind Friends I am resolved to discover a thing,".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
